meanings.definition: Something offered or won as an award for victory or superiority.
meanings.sent1: The school gave out prizes to the winners of the science fair.
meanings.sent2: At the end of the game, the team celebrated their victory with prizes.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the mouse was a prize to play with.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the real prize at the end of a long day.
meanings.sent5: The golden trophy gleamed like a priceless prize under the spotlight.

meanings.sent1: She prizes her friendship with her best friend above all else.
meanings.sent2: He prizes honesty and integrity in all his relationships.
meanings.sent3: The little girl prized her teddy bear so much that she took it everywhere.
meanings.sent4: In his heart, he prized the memories of his childhood adventures.
meanings.sent5: The artist prized every brushstroke in his masterpiece, creating a work of art.
